title: Evelynn or Nocturne?
body:
Alright here is my situation, i'm currently been playing league on and off for a year and i'm not that great and i'm not that good either or i wouldn't be in high bronze 5, low bronze 4. I wanted to identify my strengths and weaknesses. so i looked at my champion collection and saw i was the best at engage tanks and carry assassins. But assassins at the top i figured i need to learn a new one who is currently not nerfed to the ground and that works in jungle, which excludes zed, kassidan, leblanc, katarina, akail. i mostly jungle which i have the most experience in so thats why i wont mid.

The two champions that i don't have are Evelynn and Nocturne. Evelynn (going of the summary tab) offers some dmg, tankiness, utility, and mobility, while Noc offers more dmg, No tankiness, and the same amount utility and mobility, while offering cc.

I need opinions on which champion is better carry ranked games with and the least difficult so i can reach gold and get the gud border and Graves skin.

Btw if you could drop some advice on playing the champ of your opinion that would be great to!

Thanks for the help, Xfinity

replies.body:
Definitely of the opinion that you'll be able to learn Nocturne faster.  He's a bit easier than Evelynn to get a hang of and he seems to match your two strengths: engaging and assassinating people.  

I would look at some fansites for the best builds and follow them until you get a hang of him and can make your own more informed choices. Think both Electrocute and Dark Harvest are pretty good on him.  Pretty important to focus on getting to six fast and then picking your targets for ultimate wisely.

Yeah and evelynn's playstyle is a little strange, Nocturn's is Press R, engage for your Team, catch someoone out, ect. With evelynn your usually going to be catching people who are alone by warding properly, using predator to run to them, or by sneaking up behind them (so when you charm they walk into you) she requires a bit more planning and position where as Nocturn kind of just Pressing a couple key's in the right direction.

+1.

And to add to that, it is very easy for enemies and teammates alike to screw up the planning phase.

If i had a LP for every time someone with more mobility than me ran ahead and scared off my target before I could get into position, I'd be Challenger.

Also, Evelynn is more hated among the player base, so you tend to get flamed for getting screwed over a lot when it happens. It takes a whole heck of a lot of resilience and tenacity to main this chick.

Nocturne on the other hand is truly unique due to his ultimate and that's just the tip of the iceberg when it comes to his carrying power.

Nocturn is easier in general to do well with and he gives you the tools necessary to carry, evelynn requires you work a lot around her Passive and W which is a no go for an easy carry jungler, in other words, she doesn't give you a button that definitively say's "Hey, this ability is how you catch people."

Hahaha. I'm sorry. I have to post this.

No Melee champion can go toe to toe with Nocturne and live to tell the tale.

No Ranged champion can farm a lane and expect not to be zipped to in an instant.

Nocturne is a 100% counter to Evelynn in more ways than 1.

If I were not already a solid Evelynn main, I would main Nocturne. You rarely see them in Low Elo, and the ones you do see already know him in and out and are smurfing.

It is a lot easier for teammates to act along side Nocturne than it is for them to act along side Evelynn (requires less guessing on the teammate's part).

If I were you, I would go Nocturne 100% unless you take to really liking Stealth and/or melee mages.
